wikipedia_page.main: James Avon Clyde, Lord Clyde,  (14 November 1863 – 16 June 1944) was a Scottish politician and judge.

response: Born on 30 October 1898 at Heriot Row, Edinburgh, Clyde was the eldest son of Anna Margaret McDiarmid (d. 1956), daughter of Professor Peter Wallwork Latham of Cambridge.  James Avon Clyde, Lord Clyde. was educated at Edinburgh Academy, Trinity College, Oxford and the University of Edinburgh, and was admitted as an advocate in 1924 and as a King's Counsel in 1936.
* James Avon Clyde, Lord Clyde (1863–1944), Scottish Conservative politician and judge
